description: 5 x London planes (T30, T37, T40, T47, T48): Crown lift above curved access road only to 5.5m from ground level.  All branches to be cut back to suitable branch junctions, retaining  shortened furnishing growth at cut points to maintain a flowing canopy outline. 2 x limes (T32, T33): Crown lift above curved access road only to 5.5m from ground level by removal of low epicormic growth and reduction of previously reduced branches only to previous most recent reduction points, retaining  shortened furnishing growth at cut points to minimise visual impact. 1 x black walnut (T35): Crown lift above curved access road only to 4m from ground level by removal of selected low branches of 5cm diameter or less.  Reduce length of one limb projecting over access road by up to 2 m. 2 x walnuts (T38, T39): Crown lift above curved access road only to 4 m from ground level by removal of selected low branches of 5cm diameter or less, and by reduction of larger diameter low branches by up to 1 m to suitable branch junctions.   Minor reduction of branches above this height to maintain a flowing canopy outline 1x London Plane (G22): Crown lift to 2.5m above path
